Description: Fragment of black-figured pottery plate. Underside reserved and ridged; on floor, lion and boar confronted, the foreparts of each animal preserved; added red for the neck and belly stripe of the lion, the shoulder of the boar, and the band around the picture.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 86 no. 289 pl. 65)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1899)
